data.innerHTML: Developing Templates

As a developer, you can modify the starter template to create your own template.
 
You can export and download the starter template directly on your local system, but if you want to modify the default site or see the effects of changes you make to the theme, it is helpful to create a new site from the template. You can use the editor to make changes to the site and use the desktop app to access the theme files and any custom component files. When you are done, you can create a new template from the site that you modified.
 
Use the starter template to create a new site and then create a new template using the site as the template's default site.
  1. Select the starter template from the list of templates click Create Site. Name the site and click Create.
  2. Click the Sites folder, select the site, and click Edit.
  3. Provide a name for the update and click Create.
  4. Click Edit to make changes. You can add and remove pages and page content, and when you are done, save and publish your changes.
    If you make changes to the theme, you can publish the changes and see them immediately in the associated site.
  5. To create a new template with all of your changes, select the site and click Create Template.
For more information about developing templates, see Developing Templates in Developing for Oracle Content and Experience Cloud.
data.userText:

You can export and download the starter template directly on your local system, but if you want to modify the default site or see the effects of changes you make to the theme, it is helpful to create a new site from the template. When you are done, you can create a new template from the site that you modified.
 
Use the starter template to create a new site and then create a new template using the site as the template's default site.
  1. Select the starter template from the list of templates click Create Site. Name the site and click Create.

data.innerHTML:
Working with Files
 
You can download and work with individual files using the web interface, synchronize entire folders with the desktop app, or export a template to work with it offline.
 
Web Interface
 
You can browse the folders and download individual files for any of the folder types other than sites (use the site editor to work directly with sites). After you modify a file, you can upload the file that contains your changes to create a new version of the file.
 
Desktop App
 

To make the entire contents of a folder directly available on a local computer, use the desktop app to synchronize the folder to your computer. You can select and synchronize multiple folders, browse the folders, and work directly with files just as you do with other local files.

Template Export and Import
 

You can also export and download a template package as a .zip file, modify it offline, and then import it either as a new template or to replace the existing template. The template package includes the associated site, theme, and any custom components. When you’re done working offline, create a .zip file containing the template package and import it.
data.userText:
Working with Files
 
You can download and work with individual files using the web interface, synchronize entire folders with the desktop app, or export a template to work with it offline.
 
Web Interface
 
You can browse the folders and download individual files for any of the folder types other than sites (use the site editor to work directly with sites). After you modify a file, you can upload the file that contains your changes to create a new version of the file.

To make the entire contents of a folder directly available on a local computer, use the desktop app to synchronize the folder to your computer. You can select and synchronize multiple folders, browse the folders, and work directly with files just as you do with other local files.

Template Export and Import
 

You can also export and download a template package as a .zip file, modify it offline, and then import it either as a new template or to replace the existing template. The template package includes the associated site, theme, and any custom components. When you’re done working offline, create a .zip file containing the template package and import it.
